content.text:
# ElizaOS GitHub Updates

Recent activity in the ElizaOS repository includes various feature additions, bug fixes, and documentation improvements.

## New Features

- Added CREATE_POOL action in MultiversX plugin (PR #3209)
- Added configuration for enabling/disabling Twitter post generation (PR #3219)
- Implemented TON Plugin with NFT collection, item creation, metadata change and transfer actions (PR #3211)
- Added CoinGecko advanced functionality for various pools by network (PR #3170)
- Introduced Desk Exchange plugin (PR #3096)
- Added Edwin plugin to Eliza (PR #3045)
- Added Trump character that tweets in Spanish by default (PR #3119)
- Added Biome configuration to Solana ecosystem plugins (PR #3186)

## Bug Fixes

- Fixed think tag from Venice (PR #3203)
- Fixed Slack download upload attachments (PR #3194)
- Fixed attribute extraction from raw text instead of normalized JSON (PR #3190)
- Updated provider-utils (PR #3189)
- Updated pnpm version during Docker build (PR #3158)
- Removed duplicated dependencies (PR #3215)
- Removed duplicated plugins (PR #3126)
- Fixed plugin-anyone (PR #3107)
- Made various fixes after v0.1.9 (PR #3141)
- Optimized and fixed quick-intel plugin (PR #3208)

## Documentation Updates

- Renamed chat_2024-11-17.md (PR #3210)
- Updated FAQ (PR #3207)
- Fixed typos and improved consistency in community chat logs (PR #3206)
- Added weekly contributor meeting notes (PR #3204)
- Updated Twitter references to X (Twitter) (PR #3198)
- Updated GitHub Actions workflows and documentation (PR #3166)
- Fixed README_JA.md by adding unwritten text and fixing typos (PR #3153)

## Other Changes

- Standardized Security Check Identifiers across GoPlus plugin (PR #3164)

categories.title: Recent Issues in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text: Several deployment and build issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza repository. Users are experiencing build errors when deploying on render.com (Issue #3212) and runtime import errors in NestJs environments with ERR_PACKAGE_PATH_NOT_EXPORTED (Issue #3191). Additionally, Docker errors have been reported specifically on Mac M1 hardware (Issue #3239).

Multiple Twitter-related issues have been identified, including general Twitter agent functionality problems (Issue #3202), logging bugs (Issue #3201), and post/reply formatting errors (Issue #3245). These issues appear to be affecting the Twitter integration capabilities of the platform.

Users have reported configuration and functionality issues, including model configurations not being loaded from character files (Issue #3233), problems with bridging and swapping tokens in the plugin-evm module (Issue #3234), and a bot repeatedly posting the same reply format message after each interaction (Issue #3252).

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been made to the elizaOS/eliza repository, focusing on various improvements and new features:

1. Blockchain-related updates:
   - PR #3187 fixed ESM imports for Anchor in the Solana developers helpers package
   - PR #3209 added CREATE_POOL action to the MultiversX plugin
   - PR #3211 implemented NFT collection features for the TON Plugin, including item creation, metadata changes, and transfers
   - PR #3199 added Wallet Management functionality to the TON Plugin

2. Twitter-related changes:
   - PR #3237 cleaned up the 'Get tweet' functionality
   - PR #3222 merged a pull request related to disabling Twitter posts
   - PR #3242 addressed Twitter proxy URL issues

3. Repository maintenance:
   - PR #3216 merged the develop branch into main
   - PR #3220 fixed Docker and types issues

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From February 3-4, 2025, there were 23 new pull requests with all 23 being merged, along with 6 new issues and 48 active contributors. The following day (February 4-5, 2025) saw increased activity with 26 new pull requests (though only 3 were merged), 11 new issues, and a slight increase to 50 active contributors.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
